research_area: The primary research areas include spatial analysis of urban spaces, focusing on the effects of urbanisation and industrialisation during the 20th century as depicted in the various Spanish novels. It examines how urban spaces intersects with social inequalities, including class, race, gender, and other social divisions. The research also investigates how capitalist driven urbanization has contributed to issues such as alienation, loss of identity, and spatial injustice in the city.
research_overview: My research critically analyses the depiction of urban life in Barcelona through the works of Eduardo Mendoza and Manuel Vázquez Montalbán. It investigates how rapid urbanization and industrialization, driven by capitalism, resulted in the unequal distribution of wealth and opportunities, creating deep social and spatial divisions. Drawing on the spatial theories of Lefebvre, Harvey, and Soja, the study presents a socio-spatial analysis of the city, exploring how the evolving urban space both reinforced and challenged various forms of inequality. The research explores the economic, social, and cultural factors contributing to these inequalities and assesses how capitalism intensifies spatial injustice, alienation, and loss of identity.
publications: Published papers in UGC care journals and other reputed peer reviewed journals. Presented paper in various national and international conferences. Has supervised various dissertation/thesis of students.  At campus level, has worked as Student Advisor, In-charge Entrepreneurship Cell, Scholarships, Library, Sports, etc.

research_area: Research  interest in area of Magnetorheological Finishing, Smart Cutting Fluids, Hydraulic and Pneumatic System,  Manufacturing Process Automation
research_overview: Magnetorheological finishing process use a unique machining abrasive mixture called Magnetorheological Fluid. This cutting fluid has the feature that its flow and viscosity can be influenced with the help of magnetic field applied in the machining zone. Experimental work was conducted to find out the effect of different compositions of M R fluids to find out the most effective composition of Bi-dispersible M R fluid. Bi-dispersible magnetorheological fluid containing both Nano and Micro size CIP has been investigated experimentally on hard metal materials. Surface roughness and induced residual stress were measured for each work piece, before and after finishing with M.R. fluid samples. The results were compared and the impact on surface roughness and induced residual stress were evaluated.

research_overview: Today the e-commerce, fashion branding, and cultural heritage intersection is redefining the way the modern narrative of the body is framed. The study “Weaving Digital Identities: The Convergence of e-commerce, Fashion Branding and Cultural Legacy of ODOP Banaras Brocades in Shaping Body” investigates the impact of digital platforms on perceptions of body image by tracing through the lens of heritage textiles; specifically, the Banaras Brocade tradition that is used to understand the use of heritage textiles in building inclusivity and self-acceptance. Traditional craftsmanship is integrated with modern representation as e-commerce enables accessibility and fashion branding features the beauty standard of people as an opportunity to tell more stories.

research_area: Akhilesh Kumar’s primary research focuses on adaptive clothing and hospital wear, aiming to enhance the functionality and accessibility of garments for patients with special needs. This interdisciplinary study intersects fashion design, healthcare, and technology to develop innovative clothing solutions that improve comfort, ease of use, and inclusivity in medical settings. His work emphasizes user-centered design principles, ensuring that the clothing adapts to the varied and specific requirements of individuals facing mobility and health challenges.
research_overview: My research focuses on adaptive clothing and hospital wear, aiming to enhance the comfort and functionality for patients with special healthcare needs. This work involves developing garments that are easy to use, compatible with medical devices, and aesthetically pleasing, while engaging with healthcare professionals and patients for insights that drive design improvements. The goal is to create innovative, practical solutions that support patient care and well-being.

overview:

MBA – Strategic Management and Entrepreneurship, School of Business and Technology, Washington DC, USA
Post Doctorate- Biological and Medicinal Chemistry, University of Massachusetts, Boston, USA

MSc- Biomedical Science, ACBR, University of Delhi, Delhi
BSc (Hons)- Chemistry, KMC, University of Delhi, Delhi.


Professor Gagan Dhawan did his graduation and post-graduation from University of Delhi, India. He was the recipient of the CSIR-Catch Them Young Award twice during his post-graduation in Biomedical Science under HRD for Biomedical Research: CSIR-University Interaction Model. He joined Ranbaxy Research Laboratories (Preclinical Pharmacokinetics and Metabolism Division) as a Research Chemist. After a few months, his interest in teaching attracted him to join the Department of Biomedical Science, Acharya Narendra Dev College, University of Delhi in August 2000. He did his doctorate from CSIR-Institute of Genomics and Integrative Biology, Delhi.

He was awarded Universitas 21 Fellowship to pursue Master’s in Bioinformatics from the University of Edinburgh, Scotland, UK. He was also invited as Visiting Faculty (August, 2011) at Laboratoire de Chimie des Polymères Organiques (LCPO), University of Bordeaux, France. He also visited Structural Biology Group, University of Edinburgh, UK (June, 2012) and Bradley Research Group, School of Chemistry, University of Edinburgh, UK (June, 2013) as Visiting Scientist.

Further, he is recipient of the prestigious UGC-Raman Award to pursue Post-Doctoral Research at 67dbb6508ca4a5cd0c114a78, University of Massachusetts, Boston, USA for a period of 12 months (2016-17). Besides research, he was also involved in teaching organic chemistry as adjunct faculty at University of Massachusetts, Boston. He has published his research in various reputed journals and delivered invited talks in India and abroad.

He was also awarded with the prestigious “Strada Scholarship for Emerging Leaders-2021” with 100% fee waiver and completed his MBA with specializations in Strategic Leadership, Strategic Thinking and Entrepreneurship.in 2023 from School of Business and Technology, Washington DC, USA (March, 2023).

He is an elected Fellow of Indian Chemical Society (FICS) and Chartered Chemist (CChem) and Fellow of Royal Society of Chemistry (FRSC), London, UK. He is also a proud member of National Network of Mathematical and Computational Biology (NNMCB) funded by Science and Engineering Research Board, Department of Science and Technology, Government of India, to provide training to students in mathematical and computational biology and to promote research activities. He is selected as IoE Fellow at Delhi School of Skill Enhancement & Entrepreneurship Development (DSSEED), Institution of Eminence, University of Delhi.

Considering his contribution to teaching excellence, he received the Meritorious Teacher Award-2014, by the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of NCT of Delhi, India and INSA Teachers Award-2020 by the Indian National Science Academy, Government of India.

His research interest focuses on:
– Identification and optimization of novel inhibitors against therapeutic drug targets using in silico screening and chemical synthesis and development of comprehensive tools for the same to aid in drug discovery process.

– Design and development of natural polymer based smart self-assembled nanostructures for biomedical applications.

Dr. Joshi has worked as Incharge and Head of Department (HOD) for 8 years. He has been a member of the Curriculum Committee, Deputy Controller at Common Entrance Test (CET) 2012-2015 and Secretary of the Advisory Committee of CET 2014-15. He was also a member of the High-Level Committee for Inter-Polytechnic Sports, Member and Chairman of several committees such as Canteen, Bus, Sports, Library, Teaching Aids, Enquiry Committee, and Purchase Committee. He is also an experienced Paper Setter, Moderator, Deputy Superintendent of Exams, Centre Supervisor of Spot Assessment and also a member of the Unfair Means Committee. Dr. Joshi was also a member of the Panel of Interview for Contractual Lecturers in Polymer Technology and Applied Chemistry.
